      • isAndroidGetsocknameError

        public static boolean isAndroidGetsocknameError(java.lang.AssertionError e)
        Returns true if e is due to a firmware bug fixed after Android 4.2.2. https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=54072
        Parameters:
        e - the suspected error
        Returns:
        true if error is due to firmware bug, false otherwise

      • skipAll

        public static void skipAll(okio.Source source)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Goes through the Source and consumes all the contents
        Parameters:
        source - the Source to consume data from
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - upon failed IO operations

      • skipAll

        public static boolean skipAll(okio.Source source,
                              int duration,
                              java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads until in is exhausted or the deadline has been reached. This is careful to not extend the deadline if one exists already.
        Parameters:
        source - the target source to be exhausted
        duration - the time available for exhaustion
        timeUnit - the time unit of exhaustion time
        Returns:
        true if the source was exhausted without closing, false if time ran out
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on an IO error

      • readNumberLe

        public static long readNumberLe(okio.BufferedSource source,
                                int byteCount)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a number from the BufferedSource
        Parameters:
        source - the data source to read from
        byteCount - the number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        the number extracted from the source
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on failed IO operations

      • peekNumberLe

        public static long peekNumberLe(okio.BufferedSource source,
                                int offset,
                                int byteCount)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Peeks but does not consume a number from a BufferedSource
        Parameters:
        source - the data source to peek from
        offset - marks where should the peeking begin
        byteCount - the number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        the number extracted form the BufferedSource
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on failed IO operations

      • peekNumberLe

                         throws java.io.IOException
        Peeks but does not consume a number from a BufferedSource
        Parameters:
        source - the data source to peek from
        byteCount - the number of bytes to peek
        Returns:
        the number value extracted from the source
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on an IO error
